title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 November 2016 - XWiki
content:
<moep> has quit  
01:09 <D-Spair> has quit  
01:29 <systemd> has quit  
01:34 <systemd> has joined #xwiki  
01:36 <Enygma`> has quit  
01:40 <sorinello\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:43 <sorinello> has quit  
02:58 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
03:01 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
03:01 <vmassol> has quit  
06:10 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <mflorea> has quit  
09:11 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <vmassol1> good morning  
09:39 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
09:47 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] Please do not commit anymore on stable-8.4.x  
09:51 <gdelhumeau> The release is already late  
09:53 <tmortagne> vmassol: [ERROR] /home/hudsonagent/jenkins\_root/workspace/Contrib - LDAP/ldap-legacy/ldap-legacy-authenticator/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/ldap/XWikiLDAPConfig.java:[133,9] reference to XWikiLDAPConfig is ambiguous, both constructor XWikiLDAPConfig(java.lang.String,com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiContext) in org.xwiki.contrib.ldap.XWikiLDAPConfig and constructor XWikiLDAPConfig(java.lang.String,org.xwiki.configuration.ConfigurationSource) in org.xwiki.c  
09:53 <tmortagne> also 12 test are failing but maybe you are already on it since I saw you were talking about working on tests  
09:54 <vmassol> weird, checking  
09:54 <tmortagne> see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/Contrib%20-%20LDAP/49/  
09:54 <vmassol> ah maybe java 8 vs 7  
09:55 <vmassol> yes that must be it since all is passing locally with java 8  
09:56 <vmassol> hmm no it's passing with java7 too locally  
09:57 <vmassol> checking job console  
09:58 <vmassol> ah ok didn't realize there were functional etsts )  
09:58 <vmassol> :)  
09:59 <vmassol> so I broke something apparently  
09:59 <tmortagne> vmassol: the tests you broken are closer to unit tests that full integration tests  
10:00 <tmortagne> (but they are using a real LDAP server)  
10:00 <vmassol> I meant -Pintegration)tests  
10:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: just telling you that they might be broken because of how the test are setup, not for a real runtime brekage  
10:04 <vmassol> yep  
10:04 <vmassol> thx  
10:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: is there an easy way for me to run this in my IDE?  
10:15 <vmassol> seems there's an xwiki instance, so I'l start it from the command line  
10:16 <vmassol> not enough  
10:17 <tmortagne> vmassol: as I said those are unit test  
10:17 <tmortagne> they don't need an XWiki instance  
10:17 <tmortagne> those that are failing that is  
10:17 <tmortagne> I just run then as any unit test with Eclipse  
10:17 <tmortagne> s/then/them/  
10:18 <vmassol> ok  
10:18 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <tmortagne> the only full integration test is in org.xwiki.contrib.ldap.ui package  
10:24 <mflorea> has quit  
10:24 <msmeria> has quit  
10:24 <blabla2[m]> has quit  
10:25 <jihad[m]> has quit  
10:25 <M-mouhb> has quit  
10:25 <M-yflory> has quit  
10:25 <M-vmassol> has quit  
10:40 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: hope my english wording is not too bad ;) (review suggested)  
11:01 <gdelhumeau> lol  
11:01 <gdelhumeau> I don't even need to ask :p  
11:02 <vmassol> looks ok  
11:02 <vmassol> I still have a hard time with this summary process though  
11:02 <vmassol> I find it hard to do properly and the RN i already a summary for me  
11:03 <vmassol> s/i/is  
11:03 <vmassol> but I know we don't have the same view; we already discussed it once :)  
11:03 <vmassol> s/don't/don't all  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> I read the "get rid" was informal but I thought it was OK  
11:04 <vmassol> If we want to keep doing summary of summary we need to better define the strategy IMO  
11:04 <vmassol> ie how to do it, what's important to list there, what should not  
11:05 <vmassol> I'm always embarassed when I do a release and I'm never sure what to put  
11:05 <vmassol> anyway  
11:05 <vmassol> :)  
11:05 <vmassol> topic for another day!  
11:07 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <blabla2[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <aloisdg[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <M-yflory> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <jihad[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <M-mouhb> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <M-vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <Chris[m]1> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <msmeria> has quit  
13:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm using http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension+Script+Module#HNon-interactiveandsynchronousinstall in a wiki page and I don't get any error but it's not worked. How can I check the error?  
13:54 <vmassol> ah tje job  
13:54 <vmassol> checking job logs  
13:54 <vmassol> found it  
13:54 <vmassol> :)  
13:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: since 8.1 you also have JobStatus#getError() in case the job itself failed  
13:56 <vmassol> ok cool  
13:56 <tmortagne> (in the log you might get indirect error, like listener doing bad things, etc)  
14:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: LDAP build is still failing  
14:14 <tmortagne> still the java 7 vs java 8 error  
14:14 <vmassol> weird since I built with java 7 locally  
14:15 <vmassol> ah legacy  
14:15 <vmassol> that's why  
14:15 <vmassol> there's probably a profile for it  
14:15 <vmassol> checking  
14:16 <vmassol> yep that's it, fixing  
14:17 <vmassol> I broke a bit the api when using null as the xwikicontext since i also introduced another signature  
14:18 <vmassol> new XWikiLDAPConfig(null, null) is now ambiguous, you need new XWikiLDAPConfig(null, (XWikiContext) null) or better new XWikiLDAPConfig(null)  
14:18 <tmortagne> it's source breakage so not a big deal  
14:18 <vmassol> btw does it mean that revapi is not running for it?  
14:19 <tmortagne> s/revapi/clirr/  
14:20 <tmortagne> clirr does not check source breakages  
14:22 <tmortagne> or at least does not produce errors for them  
14:22 <vmassol> indeed if clirr is used it won't check for that, I guess our dep is too old for revapi  
14:22 <vmassol> \*parent dep  
14:23 <tmortagne> our dep is current LTS, we are not using revapi since very long  
14:24 <vmassol> yep, don't remember when exactly  
14:51 <olivier-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <olivier-ow2> Hi !, where can i find how the Header Id are generated (i mean #HsomeAnchor ), i need to know which characters are  escaped or replaced  tmortagne, vmassol  
14:57 <tmortagne> olivier-ow2: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/blob/master/xwiki-rendering-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/util/IdGenerator.java  
14:57 <tmortagne> I think  
14:58 <olivier-ow2> hum.. ok.. seem to not easy to reprocude the behavior in javascript  
14:59 <olivier-ow2> there is a way to convert a title as ID, in velocity ? tmortagne  
15:00 <tmortagne> olivier-ow2: no official API AFAIK  
15:00 <tmortagne> but I guess you would parse a header using rendering script service and get the id of the header from the generated XDOM  
15:01 <vmassol> tmortagne and all: I'd like to configure an empty repository list in PackageMojo by default so that 1) our tests don't contact any outside server and 2) to speed up the tested instances. Ofc a test can override if need be but I believe this should be the default. WDYT?  
15:02 <olivier-ow2> tmortagne: ok thanks, i will deal with that  
15:03 <tmortagne> vmassol: tough it was the case already  
15:03 <vmassol> I thught too  
15:03 <vmassol> \*thought  
15:03 <tmortagne> that too  
15:03 <vmassol> ah maybe it's done by not having some dependencies by default  
15:03 <vmassol> but the list of repos is not modified by default  
15:04 <tmortagne> if you don't include maven and xwiki repositories handler in packager plugin then yes you don't have any repository by default  
15:04 <vmassol> ok then that's how it's done  
15:04 <vmassol> cool  
16:03 <tmortagne> mflorea: do you know about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards-8.4.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_HTML5\_validity\_for\_\_xwiki\_CKEditor\_AdminSection\_\_\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ ?  
16:03 <tmortagne> ERROR: Bad value “” for attribute “id” on element “form”  
16:03 <mflorea> yes, will be fixed after we upgrade CK  
16:04 <mflorea> I fixed it already on the CK but I haven't released 1.10 yet, I'm working on https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/CKEDITOR-68  
16:05 <tmortagne> ok  
16:07 <gdelhumeau> yes we can ignore it for the release of 8.4  
16:25 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
16:40 <msmeria> has quit  
17:01 <olivier-ow2> has quit  
17:05 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:08 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:36 <vmassol> hmm seems PackageMojo doesn't honor <exclusions>….  
18:01 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:02 <gdelhumeau> WTF  
18:03 <gdelhumeau> I'm waiting for the build to be secure  
18:03 <gdelhumeau> and now we have a commit on stable-8.4.x  
18:04 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: either I do not continue the release, either I release now without waiting  
18:04 <vmassol> don't worry gdelhumeau it's not dangerous  
18:04 <vmassol> just checked it  
18:04 <vmassol> you should continue if that's the only problem  
18:07 <gdelhumeau> now we have http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Quality-8.4.x/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-tool-standards-validator/testReport/org.xwiki.validator/HTML5ValidatorTest/testValid/ that I can reproduce locally  
18:07 <gdelhumeau> age: 1  
18:08 <gdelhumeau> probably because xwiki-platform have not really be rebuild for a while  
18:14 <gdelhumeau> I think I can release anyway  
18:14 <gdelhumeau> The profile quality is not working on the module xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-standards-validator  
18:15 <gdelhumeau> looks like a bug in relaxng  
18:15 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: do you think it's ok?  
18:20 <sagarhani> has quit  
18:22 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: yes probably ok  
18:22 <gdelhumeau> ok I start the release  
18:22 <sagarhani> has joined #xwiki
